name: "The Dresden Files" - "Things That Go Bump" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who walked through the wall several times in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Bob.

	Bob was a ghost, and therefore didn't have to use a door or other opening to pass through to other rooms. That also meant he wasn't able to touch any physical items. Bob's spirit lived inside his skull from when he was alive. The skull was normally kept in Dresden's lab.

questions.text: What was Harry doing when Lt. Murphy walked into Dresden's office?
questions.explanation:
Yoga.

	She stopped on her way to work to see if he knew anything about an explosion with green flames that happened a few blocks from his office. He didn't admit to knowing anything about it. Throughout the series the two of them had a love/hate relationship.

questions.text: Which injured wizard sought sanctuary with Dresden?
options: A pinball player with an ironic nickname
questions.explanation:
Ancient Mai.

	The Ancient Mai was the head of the Chicago High Council of Wizards, and didn't like Dresden. She was injured and carried into his office. She, the Morgan and others were being chased by someone or something unknown.

questions.text: How old was Lt. Murphy's daughter?
questions.explanation:
9.

	This was the first time in the series that her daughter was mentioned. Harry complained that Murphy wore the same necklace every day, to which she replied it was a gift from her daughter. She reminded him about her and he responded by saying she didn't talk about her daughter much.

questions.text: Who did Harry reveal his powers to?
questions.explanation:
Lt. Murphy

	After months of knowing each other, he finally revealed his powers were real. He didn't have much of a choice after she was trapped in his office's with all of the other magical beings. Generally it was against wizard rules to reveal themselves to non-magical beings.

questions.text: Bob was killed during the attack on Harry's office
questions.explanation:
False.

	Being a ghost, Bob was not injured during any of the fighting. Bob was forever cursed to live as a ghost, unable to crossover. He was only able to watch as the others did the fighting.

questions.text: Who was elected to walk into the black fog surrounding the building?
questions.explanation:
Bob.

	It was well known that the black fog caused instant death to anything alive, so Bob was elected to see how thick it was. The rest of them didn't know how it would affect him. It severed his own connection to his skull, stopping him from being called back to the room.

questions.text: Whose father appeared through the black fog?
questions.explanation:
Harry.

	Lt. Murphy thought she saw her father, but only Harry's actually appeared. He tried to warn Harry and Murphy about something but was sucked back into the blackness before he could.

questions.text: What were the "Wizard cops" known as?
questions.explanation:
Wardens.

	Wardens were the same as a standard beat cop. They worked under the Morgan, who worked for the high council. Several wardens visited Harry at times throughout the series, though it wasn't until this episode where they were formally named.

questions.text: Who ended up being the evil entity in the episode?
questions.explanation:
Murphy.

	She was invited into Harry's office at the beginning of the episode and ended up inside the office when the attack started. Turned out it wasn't Murphy, but an evil Dregg. A Dregg was a shape-shifting creature.
